tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Precision cooking: enabling new textures and flavors | Lecture 2 (2011)
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis:
Speaker: Joan Roca (El Celler de Can Roca)
Location: Science Center C

tva:Genre.tva:Name: Non-linear audio-video
tva:Genre.tva:Definition: Services where the interaction is based mostly around choosing alternate audio or video files - VOD and AOD, maybe combined with 2.1.1.15 (multi stream)

tva:HowRelated.tva:Name: Recommendation
tva:HowRelated.tva:Definition: The reference points to a resource recommended the provider of the current resource. The service provider considers there to be similarities between the currently described resource and the referenced resource. Example: This could provide access to previous or next episodes or to all episodes (the parent series as a whole). Suggestion to record a programme which the broadcaster recommends because of what the user is watching.It could also point to a Web site proposing related programmes ‘recommended’ by the service provider. A recommendation can be used to suggest content or services or services bundles with a similar subject.

tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: there were a couple instances﻿ where the lecturer was making references to the overhead and the camera showed instead the guy talking. Really, Harvard? smarten up. Other than that I found this to be very informative and interesting.

1:07 He is so nervous he almost trips and﻿ falls. Umh umh I do this sometime but it's not good to over do it. He is walking around too much without a purpose. If you know something about good communication you know what I am talking about.
These lectures are amazing ! Hopefully, Joan's translator is much﻿ better than the one from last year.
The translator is﻿ like he need to pee
/watch?v=JVN79bwqJrw speech from ﻿ Charlie Chaplin him self.... watch it is much worth it greates speech ever by a human.

Reviewer.Music: Noiserv, Marina and the Diamonds, Coldplay, Greenday, Lilly Allen, Devilz-Speciez, and music with depth
